features.label: africanports1887
features.title: African Ports, 1887
features.description: 305 settlements and ports on the West African coast
features.creator: Dr. Patricia Seed

features.label: afr_subregions_hl
features.title: Pre-Colonial African Subregions
features.description: Pre-Colonial African Subregions with descriptions.

features.label: amh_20210622
features.title: Atlas of Mutual Heritage
features.description: The Atlas of Mutual Heritage is a growing database containing information about, and images of, the charter areas of the VOC (Dutch East India Company) and WIC (Dutch West India Company).
features.creator: [Nationaal Archief (Dutch National Archives)]; [Rijksdienst het Cultureel Erfgoed (Dutch Cultural Heritage Agency)]; [Rijksmuseum Amsterdam]; [Koninklijke Bibliotheek (Dutch National Library)]

features.label: Andriveau1880Africa
features.title: Eugène Andriveau-Goujon 1880 Africa Map
features.description: The following is a list of settlements in Eugène Andriveau-Goujon's 1880 map “Carte générale de l’Afrique, d’après les dernières découvertes.” The map was georeferenced and point data was added for settlements through GIS. Settlement data reflects only the mainland African continent, as the spatial transformations necessary for accuracy in the mainland led to some distortion of Madagascar, outlying areas, islands, etc.
features.creator: Eugène Andriveau-Goujon

features.label: antilles
features.title: KIT gazetteer Dutch Antilles
features.description: Gazetteer developed by the Koninklijk Instituut voor de Tropen (Royal Tropical Institute) in the Netherlands, in order to allow users to produce geographical queries on the KITs Dutch Colonial Maps Collection.
features.creator: [Koninklijk Instituut voor de Tropen (KIT)]

features.label: black
features.title: DK Atlas of World History
features.description: Data culled from the index and maps of DK Atlas of World History. Jeremy Black, Ed.. DK Publishing (2005)
features.creator: Jeremy Black

features.label: bregel759_20200826
features.title: An Historical Atlas of Central Asia
features.description: This dataset comprises 759 place records, digitized in 2018 from 15 of the 48 maps in Yuri Bregel's scholarly atlas. The maps' extensive sources, detailed in the Preface and Notes, include "...all reliable general surveys of Central Asian history, and scholarly works on specific historical topics that contain significant historico-geographical information, with or without maps." The data comprises  not only settlements, but historical cultural and political regions, spatial extents for which are indeterminate and indicated by dashed boundaries around their labels on the map plates.
features.creator: Yuri Bregel

features.label: bscaa
features.title: Bureau of South & Central Asian Affairs
features.description: This dataset includes the eighteen countries that make up the Bureau of South and Central Asian Affairs, an agency within the US Department of State

features.label: bulgariatheophanes
features.title: Theophanes Bulgaria Places
features.description: Places mentioned in conjunction with early Bulgars/Bulgaria by Theophanes Confessor in his Chronicle. Theophanes was an 8th/9th Century Byzantine Chronicler and Monk. This chronicle is one of the most important sources for knowledge about the early Bulgars.
features.creator: Justin Piel

features.label: BurkinaFSettlements
features.title: Burkina Faso Settlements
features.description: Burkina Faso Settlements as compiled by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Burkina Faso publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. The settlements dataset contains the location of cities, towns and villages in Burkina Faso. Data was transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: [OCHA Burkina Faso Services]

features.label: CARSettlements
features.title: Central African Republic Settlements
features.description: Central African Republic Settlements as compiled by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. The dataset shows the villages and towns of Central African Republic. Data was transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: [OCHA Central African Republic Services]

features.label: ChadSettlements
features.title: Chad Settlements
features.description: Chad Settlements as compiled by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. The dataset shows village locations in Chad. Data was transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: [OCHA Chad Services]

features.label: chgis_cnty_1911
features.title: Chinese Counties, 1911
features.description: The China Historical GIS (CHGIS) project has produced a comprehensive series of datasets related to the administrative geography of Chinese History. This dataset contains 1,985 counties for the year 1911. CHGIS was an international collaborative effort made up of research and technical teams, a management committee, and an advisory committee. The members who participated are recorded here: https://chgis.fairbank.fas.harvard.edu/pages/members/
features.creator: [CHGIS]

features.label: chgis_pref_1911
features.title: Chinese Prefectures, 1911
features.description: The China Historical GIS (CHGIS) project has produced a comprehensive series of datasets related to the administrative geography of Chinese History. This dataset contains 1,985 counties for the year 1911. CHGIS was an international collaborative effort made up of research and technical teams, a management committee, and an advisory committee. The members who participated are recorded here: https://chgis.fairbank.fas.harvard.edu/pages/members/
features.creator: [CHGIS]

features.description: The China Historical GIS (CHGIS) project has produced a comprehensive series of datasets related to the administrative geography of Chinese History. The members who participated are recorded here: https://chgis.fairbank.fas.harvard.edu/pages/members/
features.creator: [CHGIS]

features.title: Chinese Towns, 1911
features.description: The China Historical GIS (CHGIS) project has produced a comprehensive series of datasets related to the administrative geography of Chinese History. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.

features.title: Côte d'Ivoire Settlements
features.description: Côte d'Ivoire Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: [OCHA West and Central Africa (ROWCA) Services]

features.label: crete_violence_01
features.title: Crete Violence
features.description: This dataset records all the sites with archaeological or epigraphic evidence for violence on Crete or violence enacted by Cretans in the Archaic and Classical periods (c. 700-400 BCE). It derives from Jesse Obert's PhD dissertation, in which he quantifies and visualizes all the evidence and includes a full bibliography. See: Obert, Jesse. 2023. “Violence and Polis Formation on Crete in the Age of Hoplite Warfare, 700-400 BCE.” Doctoral Thesis, Berkeley: University of California, Berkeley.
features.creator: Jesse Obert

features.label: curacao_29
features.title: Curaçao Historical Administrative Areas
features.description: Spatiotemporal GIS layer of administrative areas (quarters; divisions; districts; urban neighbourhoods) in the island of Curaçao under Dutch, post-WIC control (1792-1954).
features.creator: Rombert Stapel

features.label: DecolonizFrWAfrica
features.title: Decolonization of French West Africa
features.description: Places mentioned or covered in various literature about the decolonization of French West Africa and the formation of current West African countries. Place names from primary and secondary sources are both represented.
features.creator: Justin Piel

features.label: depoptest
features.title: Villages Depopulated During Arab-Israeli Conflicts
features.description: A list of villages depopulated by conflicts between Arab and Israeli powers in the 19th and 20th centuries. This dataset does not include any information following 7 October 2023.
features.creator: Arieh L. Avneri

features.label: DOI3404
features.title: Sq_ replacement names (US Board on Geographic Names)
features.description: In response to the Department of the Interior Secretarial Order 3404 this is the list of U.S. Board on Geographic Names approved official Sq_ replacement names. On November 19, 2021, Order 3404 declared "squaw" a derogatory term and implemented a procedure to remove the term from federal usage.
features.creator: Alexandra Straub

features.label: dplace
features.title: D-PLACE
features.description: D-PLACE (the Database of Places, Language, Culture, and Environment) contains cultural, linguistic, environmental and geographic information for over 1400 human ‘societies’. A ‘society’ in D-PLACE represents a group of people in a particular locality, who often share a language and cultural identity. All cultural descriptions are tagged with the date to which they refer and with the ethnographic sources that provided the descriptions. The majority of the cultural descriptions in D-PLACE are based on ethnographic work carried out in the 19th and early-20th centuries (pre-1950). Credits: https://d-place.org/about#team

features.label: ds_1438
features.title: Exploring Slave Trade in Asia
features.description: The Exploring Slave Trade in Asia Dataset presents 474 records with some geographic coordinates. Each entry provides the title, name variants, start year, type, aat code, and a description field which contains extra information including citations.
features.creator: Pascal Konings; Maartje Hids; Sam Miske; Matthias Rossum; Merve Tosun; Hannah Korte,

features.label: EritreaSettlements
features.title: Eritrea Settlements
features.description: Eritrea Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: [OCHA Regional Office for Southern and Eastern Africa (ROSEA)]

features.label: euarasia_whsites
features.title: Eurasia UNESCO World Heritage Sites
features.description: These sites span 6 countries of Northern and Central Asia: Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, Russia, and China. These sites are landmarks or areas that have been designated by UNESCO to have "cultural and natural heritage"  which is considered "of outstanding value to humanity." Sites vary from natural systems such as lakes and plateaus to manmade structures such as ancient towns and mausoleums.

features.label: euratlas_cities
features.title: Euratlas Cities
features.description: 3584 cities with temporally scoped names from the Euratlas Periodis Historical Atlas and Gazatteer. Polities will be added as a separate dataset.
features.creator: Christos Nüssli

features.label: Florida100
features.title: Indigenous Place Names in Florida
features.description: Place names from "A provisional gazetteer of Florida place-names of Indian derivation, either obsolescent or retained, together with others of recent application" edited by Mark F. Boyd, Tallahassee, 1956. Many of the place names stem from Creek and Hitchiti languages.
features.creator: Alexandra Straub

features.label: frankopanchp3
features.title: Place Names from "The Road to a Christian East" in Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads"
features.description: Gazetteer of Place Names from Chapter 3, "The Road to a Christian East" in Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads." Christianity had solidified itself in Rome, but its roots in Asia still held deep. At this point, the Roman Empire was shrinking, and this chapter's place names reflect the other forces that began encroaching, such as the Xiongnu and Alans. This chapter also highlights some of the earliest and largest Christian communities in Asia like Merv and Kashgar. Frankopan's message is to highlight the reach of Christianity in Asia occurring centuries before missionaries reached England or France.

features.label: frankopanchp4
features.title: Place Names from "The Road to Revolution" in Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads"
features.description: Gazetteer of Place Names from Chapter 4, "The Road to Revolution" in Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads." This chapter chronicles the rise of Islam and how it affected the surrounding regions. Frankopan describes the efforts of the Persian Empire and various campaigns in areas such as Ctesiphon and Arabia before describing the rise of Muhammad and Islam in Medina.

features.label: frankopanchp5
features.title: Place Names from "The Road to Concord" from Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads"
features.description: Gazetteer of Place Names from chapter 5, "The Road to Concord" from Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads." The place names in this chapter reflect the growing development of Islam in the Middle East and its expansion into Central Asia. Places of both success and failure are examined, with special attention to the city of Baghdad as a high point for the Islamic world. The growing expansion and connection of the empire is demonstrated in this chapter through places as far apart as Scandinavia and the Iberian peninsula.

features.label: frankopanchp6
features.title: Place Names from "The Road of Furs" in Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads"
features.description: Place Names from Chapter 6, "The Road of Furs" in Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads." This chapter chronicles the rise of the fur trade on the Silk Roads and how it contributed to continued expansion in every direction. There is also special attention to the connection between the spread of Islam and the spread of trade routes, especially for furs. The place names in this chapter include many rivers and seas and the settlements that began popping up alongside them. Additionally, peoples as diverse as the Ghuzz, Pecheneges, and Khazars are discussed in this chapter.

features.label: frankopanchp7
features.title: Place Names from "The Slave Road" in Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads"
features.description: Place Names from Chapter 7, "The Slave Road" in Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads." This chapter's place names extend farther in Europe than in previous parts of the book. This came with the introduction of the Viking Rus and an increased interest in the slave trade and how fast it could generate profit. This chapter details the earliest locations of slave markets in both Europe and Central Asia, and how these markets laid the foundation and built up economies in those areas. Through this, the sheer number of empires and powerful cities rose, as well as the Catholic Church alongside it. However, exploits in the East would soon take its toll on the Christian Byzantine Empire.

features.label: frankopanchp8
features.title: Place Names from "The Road to Heaven" from Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads"
features.description: Place Names from Chapter 8, "The Road to Heaven" from Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads." The places in this dataset revolve around the Mediterranean as it describes the Crusades and Italy's attempts at expanding to Jerusalem and the Holy Land. The chapter discusses pivotal cities of the Byzantine Empire such as Thessaloniki, as well as the continued growth of trade with Asia in countries such as China and India.

features.label: frankopanchp9
features.title: Place Names from "The Road to Hell" in Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads"
features.description: Place Names from Chapter Nine, "The Road to Hell" in Peter Frankopan's "The Silk Roads." This chapter details the Mongols under the leadership of Genghis Khan and their introduction to Egypt and the Middle East. The place names in this chapter reflect the Mongols' presence in China and Central Asia but also extend as far as Russia, the Korean peninsula, and Cairo. The chapter closes the narrative on the Crusades by detailing Mongol victories in what was once the Christain Holy Land, as European leaders set their sights elsewhere.

features.label: GabonSettlements
features.title: Gabon Settlements
features.description: Gabon Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: [OCHA West and Central Africa (ROWCA) Services]

features.label: gcasia
features.title: Ancient Greek Place Names for Central Asia
features.description: This dataset includes three regions in Central Asia that are defined by Ancient Greek primary sources. The first two are named in ancient texts, and the third, in capital letters, is only attested in Bactrian coinage. The geometries for the included polygons were traced from open source maps on Wikipedia.

features.label: GEBCO
features.title: IHO-IOC GEBCO Gazetteer of Undersea Feature Names
features.description: General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans(GEBCO) provides publicly available bathymetry data sets for the world’s oceans. The GEBCO Sub-Committee on Undersea Feature Names (SCUFN) maintains and makes available a digital gazetteer of the names, generic feature type and geographic position of features on the seafloor. GEBCO operates under the joint auspices of the International Hydrographic Organization(IHO) and the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission (IOC) (of UNESCO).
features.creator: Alexandra Straub

features.label: GhanaSettlements
features.title: Ghana Settlements
features.description: Ghana Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: [OCHA West and Central Africa (ROWCA) Services]

features.label: gn500
features.title: GeoNames cities (500)
features.description: The GeoNames geographical database covers all countries and contains over eleven million placenames that are available for download free of charge. This subset is the 500 most populous global cities, 2019. See https://www.geonames.org/team.html
features.creator: Marc Wick

features.label: GuineaSettlements
features.title: Guinea Settlements
features.description: Guinea Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: OCHA West and Central Africa (ROWCA) Services

features.label: hced_06Jan
features.title: Historical Conflict Event Dataset
features.description: The Historical Conflict Event Dataset presents 6,951 battlefields with geographic coordinates and dates, ranging from 1468 BCE to 2003 CE. Each entry provides the name, time, location and a short description for sites of historical battles. The dataset was converted from an XML file into the LPF format.

features.label: IndigNames
features.title: Indigenous Place Names of Western PA
features.description:
A collection of Indigenous place names of Western PA, originating from various local tribes. These Indigenous names are pulled from a collection of place names from George P. Donehoo's book A History of the Indian Villages and Place Names in Pennsylvania. Only village names have been pulled, not rivers or lakes. 
Citation: Donehoo, George P. A History of the Indian Villages and Place Names in Pennsylvania . Wennawoods Publishing. Lewisburg, Pennsylvania. 1998.
features.creator: Audrey Wolyniec

features.label: innerasia_christian
features.title: David Christian's Inner Asia
features.description: Digitized from Christian, David. “Inner Eurasia as a Unit of World History.” Journal of World History, vol. 5, no. 2, 1994, pp. 173–211.

features.label: innerasiahoneychurch
features.title: Inner Asia and the Spatial Politics of Empire: Archaeology, Mobility, and Culture Contact
features.description: Inner Asia and the Spatial Politics of Empire was written by William Honeychurch and published in 2015. Honeychurch gives a comprehensive analysis of Bronze age Eurasian steppe peoples, in areas covering modern China, Mongolia, Kazakhstan, and Russia. He presents archaeological data and historical evidence to argue in favor of the complex nature of pastoral nomadism. Honeychurch also emphasizes spatial politics for the Xiongnu state to decenter Chinese influences and instead study such influences in addition to indigenous contexts.

features.label: libya1349_nm
features.title: Heritage Gazetteer of Libya
features.description: The aim of the Heritage Gazetteer of Libya is to record, and to provide with Unique Identifiers, locations and monuments within modern Libya which are of significance to the history of the area up to 1950. It is based on the work of members of the Society for Libyan Studies.
features.creator: Hafed Walda

features.label: List_Novgorod_Chron
features.title: List of Russian towns, late 14c
features.description: So called “List of Russian Towns, Distant and Hither" survived in 26 copies, and the oldest copy was preserved in the Commission Scroll of the Novgorod First Chronicle
features.creator: Alexey Frolov
features.contributors: [Institute of World History of the Russian Academy of Sciences]; [Nanyang Technological University Singapore, School of Art, Design and Media (NTU-ADM)]

features.label: lugares13k_rel
features.title: HGIS de las Indias (lugares)
features.description: The lugares (settlements) in the Historical-Geographic Information System (HGIS) of the Indies (1701-1808), a project of the University of Graz, funded with the support of the Fund for Scientific Investigations of the Republic of Austria (FWF) between 2015 and 2017. The general purpose of HGIS de las Indias is to create a visualization of the historical geography for the Bourbon Spanish America through time, to create a solid systematics of the administrative-territorial structure as an interface for associated projects, as well as to promote geographic methods and digital tools in Hispano-Americanist historiography.
features.creator: Werner Stangl

features.label: MadagascarSettlement

features.description: Madagascar Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.

features.label: MaliSettlements

features.description: Mali Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.

features.label: MedievalSwahiliCoast
features.title: Medieval Swahili Coast
features.description: Places mentioned in various literature on the Swahili Coast around the Medieval Era. Archaeological discoveries and contemporary accounts are represented through secondary sources.
features.creator: Justin Piel

features.label: MonserrateMughals
features.title: Father Monserrate's Travels in Mughal India
features.description: Description of the movements of Father Antonio Monserrate during his visit to the court of Akbar. Father Monserrate depaarted from Goa in 1579 and returned in 1582. He travelled through the territories of the Mughal empire, stayed at the court of Akbar, and accompanied Akbar in his military campaign against his half-brother in Afghanistan. Data: places through which Monserrate traveled. Data consists of 140 places mentioned by Monserrate. These places represent towns, cities, rivers, mountains, mountain ranges, sacred places, and forts. Most of the places were encountered by Monserrate. In some cases, he refers to places that he did not see. Method: place names were taken from the following sources: The Commentary of Father Monserrate, S.J. on his journey to the Court of Akbar (Oxford University Press, 1922)
features.creator: Sundara Vadlamudi [American University of Sharjah]; Sarah Zahaf [American University of Sharjah]
features.contributors: Sundara Vadlamudi [American University of Sharjah]; Sarah Zahaf [American University of Sharjah]

features.label: ne_mountains
features.title: Mountain Ranges (Natural Earth)
features.description: 217 records

features.label: ne_rivers982
features.title: Global Rivers
features.description: This dataset was originally sourced from the Natural Earth public repository (naturalearthdata.com) in 2017, and is now continually augmented with concordance links to other datasets, e.g. Wikidata, TGN, and contributed datasets.
features.creator: Tom Patterson; Nathaniel Vaughn Kelso

features.label: NigerSettlements
features.title: Niger Settlements
features.description: Niger Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: [OCHA Niger Services]; [Institut National de la Statistique]

features.label: owtrad
features.title: Old World Trade
features.description: Place records drawn from "...geo/chrono-referenced data on land, river and maritime trade routes of Eurasia and Africa during the period 4,000 BCE - circa 1820 CE." Trade routes to be added in another dataset.
features.creator: T. Matthew Ciolek

features.label: pleiades20k
features.title: Pleiades (partial)
features.description: Pleiades is a community-built gazetteer and graph of ancient places. It publishes authoritative information about ancient places and spaces, providing unique services for finding, displaying, and reusing that information under open license. This is a subset of Pleiades data, including settlements, monuments, and physical geographic features. Credits: https://pleiades.stoa.org/credits

features.label: poland16c_24498
features.title: Poland localities in the 16th Century
features.description: Localities in the 16th-century Polish Kingdom. The data is a result of a project dating back to the 1960s: "Historical Atlas of Poland. Detailed maps of the 16th century", The subject of the study (published in volumes from 1966 to 2021) are Polish lands in the second half of the 16th century. Each volume consists of two parts. The first includes a detailed main map (scale 1:250,000) showing settlement, relief, afforestation, parish network, state, and church administrative divisions, and roads, as well as overview maps (scale 1:500,000) dedicated to selected issues and plans of chosen cities (scale of 1:10,000). The second part is commentaries containing an overview of the source base, methods of elaboration, and lists of localities (including, name variations, and non-localized settlements) and physiographic names.
features.creator: [Department of the Historical Atlas at the Institute of History of the Polish Academy of Sciences]

features.label: poland16c_districts
features.title: Poland districts in the 16th century
features.description: 105 districts in 16c Poland
features.creator: [Department of the Historical Atlas at the Institute of History of the Polish Academy of Sciences]

features.label: poland16c_provinces
features.title: Poland provinces in the 16th century
features.description: 23 provinces
features.creator: [Department of the Historical Atlas at the Institute of History of the Polish Academy of Sciences]

features.label: postsoviet
features.title: Map of Post-Soviet States
features.description: This map lists all the countries that emerged out of the "collapse" of the Soviet Union

features.label: rome2
features.title: Gazetteer of Stone Quarries in the Roman World
features.description: The Stone Quarries Database was compiled by Ben Russell as part of his research project on Sculpted Stone and the Roman Economy. The database includes all those quarries at which activity in the Roman period is proven or suspected. Creators of the database noted that dating these quarries to specific periods within the Roman era is usually very difficult and so has been largely avoided. The uploaded dataset uses the more general period of Imperial Rome (27BC - 476 AD) unless otherwise specially noted. Some sites may have been used prior to this period. The full dataset is available from the the Oxford Roman Economy Project.
features.creator: B.J. Russell

features.label: SãoTandPSettlements

features.description: São Tomé and Principé Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Regional Office for West and Central Africa (ROWCA) and publicly available on the Humanitarian Data Exchange. features.description: Sudan Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: [OCHA Sudan]

features.label: suriname2146
features.title: KIT gazetteer Surinam
features.description: Gazetteer developed by the Koninklijk Instituut voor de Tropen (Royal Tropical Institute) in the Netherlands, in order to allow users to produce geographical queries on the KITs Dutch Colonial Maps Collection. This collection is currently hosted by the Leiden University Library (https://digitalcollections.universiteitleiden.nl/view/collection/kitmaps).
features.creator: [Koninklijk Instituut voor de Tropen (KIT)]

features.label: territorios892
features.title: HGIS de las Indias territorios
features.description: The administrative territorios in the Historical-Geographic Information System (HGIS) of the Indies (1701-1808), a project of the University of Graz, funded with the support of the Fund for Scientific Investigations of the Republic of Austria (FWF) between 2015 and 2017. The general purpose of HGIS de las Indias is to create a visualization of the historical geography for the Bourbon Spanish America through time, to create a solid systematics of the administrative-territorial structure as an interface for associated projects, as well as to promote geographic methods and digital tools in Hispano-Americanist historiography.
features.creator: Werner Stangl

features.label: tgn_filtered_01
features.title: Getty TGN (partial)
features.description: 1.8m records from Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names (2016)
features.creator: [Getty Research Institute]

features.label: tnc_ecoregions
features.title: Ecoregions (TNC)
features.description: Terrestrial Ecoregions. Retrieved from The Nature Conservancy Jan 2019; and no longer available. To be replaced by World Wildlife Fund dataset (see  https://www.worldwildlife.org/publications/terrestrial-ecoregions-of-the-world)

features.label: TogoSettlements
features.title: Togo Settlements
features.description: Togo Settlements as compiled by United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) publicly available via the Humanitarian Data Exchange. Data transferred to LP-TSV format and cleaned. Duplicate names, however close together, are distinct settlements according to the data.
features.creator: [OCHA West and Central Africa (ROWCA)]

features.label: trade;historical
features.title: Voyage Around the Erythraean Sea
features.description: A collection of locations mentioned in the "Periplus of the Erythraean Sea" itinerary written in the early first century by an unknown author believed to be a merchant or scholar.

features.label: Truhart
features.title: Truhart Historical Dictionary of States Entities
features.description: Geopolitical entities referenced in Peter Truhart's Historical Dictionary of States
features.creator: [Political Leaders Through Time Project]

features.label: TurtleIsland
features.title: Turtle Island Decolonized: Mapping Indigenous Names across “North America”
features.description: This dataset is a reproduction of cartographical data from "Turtle Island Decolonized: Mapping Indigenous Names across 'North America'" with the permission of the Decolonial Atlas. The dataset contains nearly 300 names, representing about 150 languages.
features.creator: Jordan Engel; [The Decolonial Atlas]

features.label: unca
features.title: UN Central Asia
features.description: This dataset includes the five countries that qualify as "Central Asian," according to the website for the United Nations.

features.label: us_counties_3890
features.title: US Counties
features.description: 17,000 polygons, temporally scoped

features.label: viabundus_10393
features.title: Viabundus
features.description: Dataset of the project Viabundus, map of premodern European transport and mobility, v. 1.2.

features.label: west_ghats_monast
features.title: Buddhist monasteries of the Western Ghats
features.description: Locations of early Buddhist rock-cut monasteries in the Western Ghats and Konkan coast regions of India. Only the caves cut between second century BCE and the early fifth century CE are included.
features.creator: Gethin Rees

features.label: whsites_2023
features.title: UNESCO World Heritage Sites, 2023
features.description:
The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) seeks to encourage the identification, protection and preservation of cultural and natural heritage around the world considered to be of outstanding value to humanity. This is embodied in an international treaty called the Convention concerning the Protection of the World Cultural and Natural Heritage, adopted by UNESCO in 1972.

What makes the concept of World Heritage exceptional is its universal application. World Heritage sites belong to all the peoples of the world, irrespective of the territory on which they are located.
features.creator: [UNESCO World Heritage Centre]

features.label: wri_lakes
features.title: Lakes (WRI)
features.description: 1491 records from a World Resources Institute dataset retrieved in 2017 and no longer available. To be replaced.

features.label: wri_watersheds
features.title: Watersheds
features.description: 226 records from dataset retrieved from World Resources Institute in 2017 and no longer availaable. To be replaced.

features.label: yukon100
features.title: Indigenous Place Names of the Yukon
features.description: Selected indigenous place names from Gazetteer of Yukon created by the Yukon Geographical Place Names Program. The dataset includes names from Yukon First Nations people including: Kaska, Tlingit, Tagish, Southern Tutchone, Northern Tutchone, Upper Tanana, Gwich'in, and Hän.
features.creator: Alexandra Straub

features.label: ZimonyiVolga
features.title: Zimonyi Volga Bulgars
features.description: Places mentioned in István Zimonyi's book The Origins of the Volga Bulgars. This book covers the origins of the Bulgars, from their first mentions in the context of Old Great Bulgaria, through the 10th Century along the Volga River.
